description.narrative: The goal is: Improved maternal, newborn and child health and a reduction in communicable disease burden in areas supported by the 3MDG Fund. The purpose is: Increased access and availability of (i) essential maternal and child health services for the poorest and most vulnerable in townships supported by the 3MDG Fund and (ii) HIV, TB, and malaria interventions for populations and areas not readily covered by the Global Fund. Expected outputs: COMPONENT 1 - Maternal, Newborn and Child Health 1.Delivery of essential services, with a focus on maternal, newborn and child health, in townships supported by 3MDG. 2.Strengthened capacity for delivery of essential MNCH services in townships supported by the 3MDG. COMPONENT 2 - HIV, Tuberculosis (TB) and Malaria 1.Prioritised HIV, TB and malaria interventions provided to targeted populations or areas not readily covered by the Global Fund. COMPONENT 3 - Health systems strengthening (HSS) 1.Prioritised components of the health system strengthened for long-term sustainability. 2.Enhanced health services accountability and responsiveness through capacity development of target communities, civil society organisations and the public sector.

title.narrative: 0.08 was reported for 2015 in Malaria National Strategic Plan (2016-2020). There is no officially available data for 2016 yet. However, in 2016 there were 13 reported malaria deaths and the number of population at risk of malaria was 43.9 million (source: National Malaria Control Programme (NMCPs) presentation at Malaria Symposium 2016). Based on this malaria mortality rate per 100,000 can be calculated as 0.03. This is not officially available data.
HIV prevalence among people who inject drugs (disaggregated by sex) in programme areas

Based on latest biological and behavioral surveillance (IBBS) (2014), the HIV prevalence among People Who Inject Drugs (PWID) was 28%. The next IBBS is planned in 2017. 2016 HIV Sentinnel Surveillance (HSS) data was not cleaned and analyzed yet. (Now the HSS will be conducted only once every two years).
Neonatal mortality rate per 1000 live births in Component 1 townships (disaggregated by sex)

In Myanmar DHS 2015-2016, the mortality rates are based on a 5-year period preceding the survey. The 2015 LogFrame target was 21. (2016 target was not set in the LogFrame, as data collection was not expected in 2016).
Under-five child mortality per 1000 live births in Component 1 Townships (disaggregated by sex)

In Myanmar DHS 2015-2016, the mortality rates are based on a 5-year period preceding the survey. The 2015 LogFrame target was 43. (2016 target was not set in the LogFrame, as data collection was not expected in 2016).
Maternal mortality ratio per 100,000 live births in Component 1 Townships

Myanmar Demographic and Health Survey (DHS) has only reported pregnancy-related mortality ratio (PRMR) for the 7-year period before the survey - 227 deaths per 100,000 live births. Maternal mortality ratio (MMR) will not be reported in this DHS due to few maternal deaths reported by sampled respondents. Based on UNFPA 2016 report, the Census-based MMR = 282 per 100,000 live births.
National TB (all forms) mortality per 100,000 population per year (disaggregated by sex and age) in programme areas
The 2016 result will not be available on time for this reporting. The 2015 result was 49 (source: Global TB report 2016).
